column2: Construct an ontology focused on the following: entities. Provide it in valid Turtle/RDF format, excluding any extra text.
column3: Here's an ontology defined in Turtle.Please note that the ontology/URIs used here are just for examples.```turtle@prefix rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#> .@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .@prefix xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#> .@prefix ont: <http://www.example.com/ontology#> .ont:Entity rdf:type rdfs:Class .ont:name rdf:type rdf:Property ;    rdfs:domain ont:Entity ;    rdfs:range xsd:string .ont:birthDate rdf:type rdf:Property ;    rdfs:domain ont:Entity ;    rdfs:range xsd:date .ont:Person rdf:type rdfs:Class ;    rdfs:subClassOf ont:Entity .ont:Organization rdf:type rdfs:Class ;    rdfs:subClassOf ont:Entity .ont:role rdf:type rdf:Property ;    rdfs:domain ont:Person ;    rdfs:range ont:Organization .```In this ontology, the class 'Entity' has two properties 'name' and 'birthDate'. Two subclasses of 'Entity', 'Person' and 'Organization', are also defined. There is also a role property which is specific to persons and links them to organizations.
